docs.lead_paragraph: The House majority leader, Representative Steny H. Hoyer of Maryland, defended on Tuesday the use of a procedural tool that would allow the House to pass a sweeping health care bill without a direct up-or-down vote on the legislation.
docs.abstract: The House majority leader on Tuesday said Democrats will use the procedure "for the same reason the Republicans used this process."
docs.snippet: The House majority leader on Tuesday said Democrats will use the procedure "for the same reason the Republicans used this process."

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated, 6:40 p.m. | Jacob S. Hacker, a political science professor at Yale, joins the discussion.

headline.main: Will It Pass? The Odds on Health Care

docs.abstract: What are the chances that a national health care overhaul will be approved this weekend?
docs.snippet: What are the chances that a national health care overhaul will be approved this weekend?

docs.lead_paragraph: Updated: Protesters descended on parts of the Capitol grounds today, voicing their opposition to health care legislation that is under debate in the House. Some organizers belonged to the Tea Party movement, and some demonstrators were focusing on vulnerable Democratic lawmakers facing tough re-election bids in conservative districts.
docs.abstract: Developments keep popping up on the health care front as the House Democratic leadership heads toward a vote and keeps the pressure on wavering lawmakers.
docs.snippet: Developments keep popping up on the health care front as the House Democratic leadership heads toward a vote and keeps the pressure on wavering lawmakers.

byline.original: By KATE PHILLIPS and ASHLEY SOUTHALL

docs.lead_paragraph: With the abortion issue still roiling the health care debate on Capitol Hill, the president of the United States Conference of Catholic Bishops has issued a statement criticizing the Senate-passed legislation as insufficient in setting restrictions on the use of federal money for insurance coverage of abortions.

headline.main: Catholic Bishops Renew Criticism of Abortion Restrictions

docs.abstract: The president of the United States Conference of Catholic Bishops criticized the abortion restrictions in the Senate health care bill, the basis for Democratic legislation going forward.
docs.snippet: The president of the United States Conference of Catholic Bishops criticized the abortion restrictions in the Senate health care bill, the basis for Democratic legislation going forward.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats awoke on Tuesday to a double-barreled shot of criticism on two of the nation's leading op-ed pages over lack of bipartisanship in the health care debate.
docs.abstract: Democrats awoke to strong criticism from two prominent op-ed pages on Tuesday.
docs.snippet: Democrats awoke to strong criticism from two prominent op-ed pages on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: As they push for a climactic vote on major health care legislation, House Democratic leaders face a bit of a conundrum: rank-and-file lawmakers detest the Senate-passed health care bill, and yet before the Democrats' overall proposal becomes law, the House somehow has to find a way to approve that Senate bill.

headline.main: Passing Health Care Legislation, Tucked in a Rule

docs.abstract: The House is pondering a strategy whereby the Senate health care bill would be "deemed" to have passed the chamber without an actual vote.
docs.snippet: The House is pondering a strategy whereby the Senate health care bill would be "deemed" to have passed the chamber without an actual vote.

docs.lead_paragraph: With states squeezing payments to providers, patients are finding it increasingly difficult to locate doctors who will accept their coverage.

headline.main: As Medicaid Payments Shrink, Patients Are Abandoned
headline.print_headline: As Medicaid Payments Shrink, Patients and Doctors Drop Out

docs.snippet: With states squeezing payments to providers, patients are finding it increasingly difficult to locate doctors who will accept their coverage.

docs.lead_paragraph: The use of reconciliation threatens to destroy the humanizing function of the Senate.
docs.snippet: The use of reconciliation threatens to destroy the humanizing function of the Senate.

docs.lead_paragraph: A failure to recognize the magnitude of the task, and a toxic political environment, undermined the effort to achieve health care reform.
docs.snippet: A failure to recognize the magnitude of the task, and a toxic political environment, undermined the effort to achieve health care reform.

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts see a gap in treatment between pediatric and adult care.

headline.main: In Cancer Fight, Teenagers Don’t Fit In
